Description: Ostracon, section (four fragments joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially mauve and grey-black in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394667) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394667)
